body.p:
Edmunton Ky. July. 20/65
Gov. T E. Bramblette
Dear Sir

At our last Curcuit Court there was a judgment obtained vs. E. R. Nance for $25.00 for trespass -- Nance is a poor ignorant hard working and inoffensive man has a large family of small children to Support which he does by his daily labor. I understand the Case to be that Nance had rented a field adjoining a Mr. Wilkison who was one of ^these^ Cunning muddlesome fellows and when Nance was from home he would contrive to get his hogs in Nance's field. About the 8th of Sept whilst Nance was at a house-raising Nance's son descovered W.s hogs in the field and took his dog
which was a severe one and in getting the hogs out one was severely injured and whilst some say the hog died others say that W= eat it Be that as it May, Wilkison in Court proved by his son that Nance injured the hog. So it died As Nance was a poor ignorant man did not Know how to manage his Case judgement went against him and I think it would be an act of charity and no detriment to the Commonwealth to remit the judgment

Your Friend Truly
John H Phillips

Metcalfe Cir Ct
vs
E R Nance
$60. 25,
Trespass
5 Oct/65
Sent for fee 9th Sept
